title: Why has Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor been arrested?
partialText: What we know about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

title: Read King and police statements in full after Andrew arrest
partialText: King releases statement after Thames Valley Police says a man is in custody and officers are searching addresses in Berkshire and Norfolk.

title: Andrew in custody as police search two addresses
partialText: The former prince remains in custody while searches take place in Norfolk and Berkshire.

title: Man guilty of XL bully offence after dog killed mother-in-law in his home
partialText: Ashley Warren, the first person to be prosecuted under XL bully laws, will be sentenced in April.

title: UK has not given US permission to use RAF bases for Iran strikes
partialText: It comes as US President Donald Trump criticises Sir Keir Starmer's deal to hand over the Chagos Islands.

title: Detained British woman describes life in Iran jail hours before being sentenced to 10 years
partialText: In a rare telephone interview from Tehran's Evin prison, Lindsay Foreman, whose husband is also held in Iran, likened their detainment to "an endurance test for the mind".

title: Arrest after two teens found dead at holiday park
partialText: A 33-year-old man has been arrested following the discovery at Little Eden Holiday Park.

title: SpaceX rocket fireball linked to plume of polluting lithium
partialText: A SpaceX Falcon 9 crashed to Earth last year. Now scientists have measured the pollution it caused.

title: Starmer appoints Dame Antonia Romeo as head of UK civil service
partialText: Dame Antonia will be the first woman to hold the post and replaces Sir Chris Wormald as the UK's top civil servant.

title: GB men into curling semis but women squeezed out
partialText: Team GB's men's are one win away from guaranteed Winter Olympic medal after sneaking into the semi-finals - but the women's team agonisingly miss out.

title: What is ski mountaineering, the sport making its Winter Olympics debut?
partialText: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what ski mountaineering is ahead of its debut at the 2026 Winter Olympics

title: Gaffe-ridden Olympic commentary prompts Italy's Rai sport chief to resign
partialText: Paolo Petrecca, whose gaffe-ridden commentary of the event went viral, stands down from his job.

title: The guide to Thursday's action - with GB's Atkin starting halfpipe medal bid
partialText: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

title: Why there's no quick fix in sight for the problem of dazzling headlights
partialText: Road users say headlight glare is an issue - but experts warn a solution might not be straightforward.

title: Yes there is a right way to stack the dishwasher. Here are the 5 rules
partialText: BBC One's Inside the Factory attempted to settle the heated debate in many households.

title: I thought being deaf would mean I couldn't be a dating show contestant - now I'm starring in one
partialText: Hold My Hand is the first show if its kind where all the contestants and hosts use  British Sign Language.

title: How a tiny pebble found on a Boxing Day walk got its 'smile'
partialText: The unusual looking fossil is estimated to be a few hundred million years old dating to the Carboniferous period.

title: Cornish village endures 50 consecutive days of rain
partialText: The exceptionally wet start to 2026 has seen the Cornish village of Cardinham confirmed as recording 50 continuous days of rain as Matt Taylor explains.

title: The 20-year-old newspaper column that gave a hint to Man City's new tactics
partialText: Pep Guardiola is using new tactics this season by making Manchester City's attack more narrow, but did he hint at the idea 20 years ago?

title: KPop stars scored the biggest global hit songs of 2025
partialText: APT by Ros√© and Bruno Mars and tracks from KPop Demon Hunters were among the biggest hits of the year.

title: Trump says world has 10 days to see if Iran deal reached
partialText: The US is surging forces to the Middle East amid negotiations with the Islamic Republic over its nuclear programme.

title: Lobbying firm co-founded by Mandelson faces collapse
partialText: Sources close to the company insist that its difficulties stem entirely from "the Mandelson legacy".

title: Chagossians trying to resettle on islands defy removal order
partialText: One says the British will have to "drag me from my beach" if they want him to leave the Chagos Islands.

title: Pupils with SEND to have support reviewed after primary, leaked plans suggest
partialText: Leaks suggest plans for a complete redesign of special educational needs and disabilities support in schools.

title: South Korea's ex-president jailed for life over martial law attempt
partialText: Yoon Suk Yeol's December 2024 martial law bid fundamentally damaged South Korea's democracy, a judge told the court.

title: BBC plans David Attenborough celebration for 100th birthday
partialText: The corporation will look back on the veteran wildlife broadcaster's career for his birthday in May.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Andrew arrest and UN fact-finding mission in Sudan
partialText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor is in custody over his links to the late Jeffrey Epstein

title: 'Anyone found guilty of racism should not be in the game'
partialText: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior says anyone found guilty of racist behaviour in football "shouldn't be in the game".

title: The eerie similarities between Arsenal's 2007-8 collapse and now
partialText: Arsenal's disappointing 2-2 draw at Wolves on Wednesday has similarities to what happened to the Gunners 18 years ago.

title: Indian-owned Hundred teams 'not considering Pakistan players'
partialText: Four sides in The Hundred with links to the IPL are not expected to sign players from Pakistan in next month's auction.
